2DGFX.name: Final Project
2DGFX.desc: A unique piece that embraces the strange & unfamiliar. This is one of my first attempts at environmental art. My inspiration mainly drew from my long commute to campus I make each day. I pass through various towns, cities, and backroads that each tell their own stories. I wanted to shed light to these stories of the ways I've seen the beautiful nature and complex urbanization I drive through clash, though not in the way you might expect.

2DGFX.name: Midterm Project
2DGFX.desc: Originally a collection of photos I took in Connecticut, I created a movie poster-like mockup using these images. I wanted to go with something a little unsettling here. It was tricky to try and come up with what seemed to be the "correct" lighting for when there's nothing but a bloodied moon emitting a soft red glow from the sky. It took a lot of blending techniques until it looked just-right to me.

HACKSU.name: YALLO
HACKSU.desc:
A rogue and rather annoying desktop virtual assistant, reminiscent of late 90's/early 2000's desktop assistants. It is designed to keep you on task and prevent procrastination, but has a rather foul tongue.

Built using python, ChatGPT, and tkinter, this group project for Kent Hack Enough 2024 won second place out of 18 other projects.

PERSONAL.name: Toy Room
PERSONAL.desc: A person piece I did over the winter. I wanted to create a room that gives you a warm and cozy feeling, full of holiday vibes. I had some friends contribute some artwork scattered throughout the room, however all of the 3D models seen here are made by me. This was done using Blender, and took approximately 3 weeks of on-and-off work to complete.

PERSONAL.name: FaceWatch
PERSONAL.desc: A facial recognition software built using python. Created for an end-of-year highschool project.
